decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay using Cloud, Midgar Mercenary as the commander. The deck includes various equipment cards to boost Cloud's power and abilities, allowing for quick and efficient attacks. It also includes disruptive spells like Swords to Plowshares and Armageddon to control the board and hinder opponents. Additionally, there are several utility creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Recruiter of the Guard to search for key cards and provide support. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful creatures equipped with potent artifacts while maintaining board control through removal spells and disruptive effects. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain momentum throughout the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing a high number of instant and sorcery spells to control the game while also disrupting the opponent's strategy. By leveraging counterspells, bounce spells, and card draw, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and take advantage of the tempo gained. The key strategy is to generate card advantage through efficient spells and use Lier's ability to cast spells from the graveyard to maintain a constant stream of threats and disruption. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of counterspells, bounce effects, and card advantage to secure victory through incremental advantage and efficient spellcasting.

The deck revolves around utilizing Azusa, Lost but Seeking's ability to play multiple lands per turn to ramp up quickly and gain a mana advantage over the opponent. This control archetype focuses on disrupting the opponent's plans with land destruction and denial cards such as Dust Bowl and Tectonic Edge. The deck also includes powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to close out the game once the mana advantage is established. The goal is to control the board and resources of the opponent while quickly ramping up mana to play game-ending threats. Additionally, the deck includes cards to tutor for specific lands or threats, ensuring consistency in the game plan.

This deck revolves around powerful graveyard interactions and reanimation spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with threats. By using cards like Buried Alive, Exhume, and Dance of the Dead, the deck aims to consistently bring back impactful creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to control the game and protect its game plan. By utilizing the commander, Emet-Selch, Unsundered, the deck can further abuse the graveyard and generate advantage over the opponent. With a mix of powerful spells and creatures, this deck looks to aggressively pressure the opponent early on and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with Aragorn, King of Gondor as the commander. It includes a mix of efficient creatures, removal spells, and countermagic to control the board while applying pressure. Cards like True-Name Nemesis, Swords to Plowshares, and Hullbreacher help disrupt the opponent's strategy, while creatures like Vendilion Clique and Snapcaster Mage provide additional value. The deck also includes various lands that can produce different colors of mana to cast its spells smoothly. By combining a proactive game plan with disruption and card advantage, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure victory in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on utilizing a diverse range of powerful creatures and spells to overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays. By ramping up mana quickly with a variety of lands and mana dorks, the deck aims to consistently cast impactful creatures such as Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Grist, the Hunger Tide. With the ability to tutor for specific creatures using cards like Imperial Recruiter and Recruiter of the Guard, the deck maintains a proactive strategy of applying pressure on opponents while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Solitude and Fury. The goal is to establish board dominance and quickly close out games before opponents have a chance to recover.

The deck focuses on utilizing Kefka, Court Mage as the commander to aggressively control the board and disrupt opponents. It contains a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and efficient creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to control the game early on with cheap interaction while deploying threats that can quickly close out the game. By efficiently disrupting the opponent's strategy and maintaining a proactive game plan, the deck is able to dictate the pace of the game and secure victories through a combination of card advantage and combat damage.

This Magda, the Hoardmaster deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing a variety of burn spells and creature removal to control the board and deal damage to the opponent quickly. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures and powerful spells, such as Lightning Bolt and Fiery Confluence, to pressure the opponent and disrupt their game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Relic of Progenitus helps to generate card advantage and disrupt graveyard strategies. The deck aims to be proactive and capitalizes on its aggressive creatures and burn spells to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.
